caption: Table 1: REBASE with lower compute budget has competitive accuracy against Sampling with higher compute budget. We use weighted voting to aggreagte the candidate solutions in both Sampling and REBASE.
description: This table compares the performance of REBASE and Sampling methods on the MATH500 dataset using different compute budgets.  It shows that REBASE, even with a significantly lower FLOPs budget, achieves competitive accuracy to Sampling with a much higher FLOPs budget.  Weighted voting is used as the aggregation method for both techniques.

caption: Table 2: Accuracy of diffrent inference configurations under a specific compute budget. MV, BON and WV denote Majority Voting, Best-of-N and Weighted Voting, respectively.
description: This table presents the accuracy results for different inference strategies (Greedy, Sampling, and REBASE) combined with different voting methods (Majority Voting, Best-of-N, and Weighted Voting) across three different language models (Mistral-7B, Llemma-7B, and Llemma-34B).  The results are shown for both the MATH500 and GSM8K datasets.  Each row represents a specific model and inference approach, showing the number of samples, FLOPs (floating-point operations) used, and the resulting accuracy on MATH500 and GSM8K. This allows for comparison of accuracy across different methods and models under the same computational budget.

caption: Table 2: Accuracy of diffrent inference configurations under a specific compute budget. MV, BON and WV denote Majority Voting, Best-of-N and Weighted Voting, respectively.
description: This table shows the accuracy results on MATH500 and GSM8K datasets using different inference strategies (Greedy, Sampling, REBASE) combined with different voting methods (Majority Voting, Best-of-N, Weighted Voting). It compares the performance of various methods under a fixed compute budget, providing insights into their effectiveness.
